alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Highland Center, or 19 miles southwest of Holyoke, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin, Wauneta and Clarkville. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 255 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
